intro: Sebaea brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazil starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found growing in shaded areas within dense forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
